name: Mount Olympus
description: The highest mountain in Greece and the mythological home of the twelve Olympian gods.

name: The Underworld
description: The gloomy realm of the dead ruled by Hades, located deep beneath the earth.

name: Delphi
description: The site of the oracle of Apollo, considered the center of the world by the ancient Greeks.

name: Asgard
description: One of the Nine Worlds and home to the Aesir tribe of gods.

name: Midgard
description: The realm of humanity (Earth), connected to Asgard by the Bifrost bridge.

name: Giza Plateau
description: The site of the Great Pyramids and the Sphinx, associated with pharaonic power and the afterlife.

name: Karnak Temple Complex
description: A vast mix of decayed temples, chapels, pylons, and other buildings near Luxor, primarily dedicated to Amun.

name: Roman Forum
description: The center of Roman public life, containing major temples including the Temple of Vesta and Temple of Saturn.

name: Capitoline Hill
description: The citadel of the earliest Romans and site of the Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus.

name: Mount Kailash
description: A peak in the Kailash Range, considered the abode of Lord Shiva and a place of eternal bliss.

name: Varanasi
description: The spiritual capital of India, situated on the banks of the Ganges, dedicated to Lord Shiva.

name: Ayodhya
description: The birthplace of Rama and setting of the Ramayana epic.

name: Ise Grand Shrine
description: The most sacred Shinto shrine, dedicated to Amaterasu, rebuilt every 20 years.

name: Izumo Taisha
description: One of the most ancient and important Shinto shrines, dedicated to Okuninushi (descendant of Susanoo).

name: Mount Fuji
description: Japan's highest mountain, considered a sacred place and dwelling of kami.

name: Floating Bridge of Heaven
description: The bridge from which Izanagi and Izanami stood to create the islands of Japan.

name: Yomi
description: The land of the dead in Japanese mythology, ruled by Izanami.

name: Newgrange (Sí an Bhrú)
description: A grand prehistoric passage tomb and the home of the Dagda (and later Aengus). Associated with the winter solstice.

name: Hill of Tara
description: The ancient seat of the High Kings of Ireland and a sacred dwelling place of the gods.

name: Tenochtitlan
description: The capital city of the Aztec Empire, built on an island in Lake Texcoco. Site of the Templo Mayor.

name: Mictlan
description: The nine-level underworld of Aztec mythology, a dangerous journey for the souls of the dead.

name: Mount Kunlun
description: A mythical mountain in the west, dwelling place of Xiwangmu (Queen Mother of the West) and source of the peaches of immortality.

name: The Heavenly Palace
description: The opulent abode of the Jade Emperor, located in the highest heavens, resembling the forbidden city.
